question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix}.\]
inference:
Solution:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos b \\ \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} - \cos (a - b) \begin{vmatrix} \cos(a - b) & \cos b \\ \cos a & 1 \end{vmatrix} + \cos a \begin{vmatrix} \cos(a - b) & 1 \\ \cos a & \cos b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (1 - \cos^2 b) - \cos (a - b) (\cos(a - b) - \cos a \cos b) + \cos a (\cos (a - b) \cos b - \cos a) \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) + \cos a \cos (a - b) \cos b - \cos^2 a \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 a - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= 1 - (\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)).
\end{align*}By the triple angle formula,
\[\cos 3x = 4 \cos^3 x - 3 \cos x.\]Then $\cos^3 x = \frac{\cos 3x + 3 \cos x}{4},$ so
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3a + 3 \cos a}{4} + \frac{\cos 3b + 3 \cos b}{4} + \frac{\cos 3(a - b) + 3 \cos (a - b)}{4} - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3a + \cos 3b + \cos 3(a - b)}{4} + \frac{3}{4} (\cos a + \cos b + \cos (a - b)) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}By the product-to-sum formula,
\begin{align*}
\cos 3a + \cos 3b &= 2 \cos \frac{3a + 3b}{2} \cos \frac{3a - 3b}{2} \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (a + b) \cos \frac{3}{2} (a - b),
\end{align*}and
\begin{align*}
\cos 3(a - b) + \cos 3a &= 2 \cos \frac{3(a - b) + 3a}{2} \cos \frac{3(a - b) - 3a}{2} \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \cos \frac{3}{2} (-b) \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \cos \frac{3b}{2}.
\end{align*}Hence,
\begin{align*}
\cos 3a + \cos 3b + \cos 3(a - b) &= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (a + b) \cos \frac{3}{2} (a - b) + 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \cos \frac{3b}{2} \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3b}{2} \left( \cos \frac{3}{2} (a + b) + \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \right) \\
&= 4 \cos \frac{3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4}.
\end{align*}Also, by the product-to-sum formula,
\begin{align*}
\cos a + \cos b + \cos (a - b) &= 2 \cos \frac{a + b}{2} \cos \frac{a - b}{2} + \cos (a - b) \\
&= 2 \cos (a - b) \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + \cos (a - b) \\
&= \cos (a - b) (2 \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + 1).
\end{align*}Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) (2 \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + 1) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{2} \cos (a - b) \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{3}{2} \cos (a - b) \cos \frac{a + b}{2} &= \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \left( a - b + \frac{a + b}{2} \right) + \cos \left( a - b - \frac{a + b}{2} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} \right).
\end{align*}Hence,
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} \right) + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} + \cos (a - b) \right) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
\cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} + \cos (a - b) &= 2 \cos \frac{\frac{3a - b}{2} + \frac{a - 3b}{2}}{2} \cos \frac{\frac{3a - b}{2} - \frac{a - 3b}{2}}{2} + \cos (a - b) \\
&= 2 \cos a \cos b + \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} (2 \cos a \cos b + \cos (a - b)) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}Finally,
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 - (\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)) \\
&= 1 - \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} - \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b - \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \boxed{1 - \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} - \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b - \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)}.
\end{align*} I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos b \\ \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} - \cos (a - b) \begin{vmatrix} \cos (a - b) & \cos b \\ \cos a  & 1 \end{vmatrix} + \cos a \begin{vmatrix} \cos (a - b) & 1 \\ \cos a  & \cos b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (1 - \cos^2 b) - \cos (a - b)(\cos (a - b) - \cos a \cos b) + \cos a (\cos (a - b) \cos b - \cos a) \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + \cos a \cos b \cos(a - b) + \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) - \cos^2 a \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 a - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos(a - b).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) - \cos^2 (a - b) &= \cos (a - b) (2 \cos a \cos b - \cos (a - b)) \\
&= \cos (a - b) (\cos a \cos b - \sin a \sin b) \\
&= \cos (a - b) \cos (a + b) \\
&= \frac{1}{2} (\cos 2a + \cos 2b) \\
&= \cos^2 a - \frac{1}{2} + \cos^2 b - \frac{1}{2} \\
&= \cos^2 a + \cos^2 b - 1.
\end{align*}Therefore, the determinant is equal to $\boxed{0}.$

question:
Solution:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos b \\ \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} - \cos (a - b) \begin{vmatrix} \cos(a - b) & \cos b \\ \cos a & 1 \end{vmatrix} + \cos a \begin{vmatrix} \cos(a - b) & 1 \\ \cos a & \cos b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (1 - \cos^2 b) - \cos (a - b) (\cos(a - b) - \cos a \cos b) + \cos a (\cos (a - b) \cos b - \cos a) \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) + \cos a \cos (a - b) \cos b - \cos^2 a \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 a - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= 1 - (\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)).
\end{align*}By the triple angle formula,
\[\cos 3x = 4 \cos^3 x - 3 \cos x.\]Then $\cos^3 x = \frac{\cos 3x + 3 \cos x}{4},$ so
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3a + 3 \cos a}{4} + \frac{\cos 3b + 3 \cos b}{4} + \frac{\cos 3(a - b) + 3 \cos (a - b)}{4} - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3a + \cos 3b + \cos 3(a - b)}{4} + \frac{3}{4} (\cos a + \cos b + \cos (a - b)) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}By the product-to-sum formula,
\begin{align*}
\cos 3a + \cos 3b &= 2 \cos \frac{3a + 3b}{2} \cos \frac{3a - 3b}{2} \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (a + b) \cos \frac{3}{2} (a - b),
\end{align*}and
\begin{align*}
\cos 3(a - b) + \cos 3a &= 2 \cos \frac{3(a - b) + 3a}{2} \cos \frac{3(a - b) - 3a}{2} \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \cos \frac{3}{2} (-b) \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \cos \frac{3b}{2}.
\end{align*}Hence,
\begin{align*}
\cos 3a + \cos 3b + \cos 3(a - b) &= 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (a + b) \cos \frac{3}{2} (a - b) + 2 \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \cos \frac{3b}{2} \\
&= 2 \cos \frac{3b}{2} \left( \cos \frac{3}{2} (a + b) + \cos \frac{3}{2} (2a - b) \right) \\
&= 4 \cos \frac{3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4}.
\end{align*}Also, by the product-to-sum formula,
\begin{align*}
\cos a + \cos b + \cos (a - b) &= 2 \cos \frac{a + b}{2} \cos \frac{a - b}{2} + \cos (a - b) \\
&= 2 \cos (a - b) \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + \cos (a - b) \\
&= \cos (a - b) (2 \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + 1).
\end{align*}Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) (2 \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + 1) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{2} \cos (a - b) \cos \frac{a + b}{2} + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{3}{2} \cos (a - b) \cos \frac{a + b}{2} &= \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \left( a - b + \frac{a + b}{2} \right) + \cos \left( a - b - \frac{a + b}{2} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} \right).
\end{align*}Hence,
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} \right) + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} \left( \cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} + \cos (a - b) \right) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
\cos \frac{3a - b}{2} + \cos \frac{a - 3b}{2} + \cos (a - b) &= 2 \cos \frac{\frac{3a - b}{2} + \frac{a - 3b}{2}}{2} \cos \frac{\frac{3a - b}{2} - \frac{a - 3b}{2}}{2} + \cos (a - b) \\
&= 2 \cos a \cos b + \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) &= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{4} (2 \cos a \cos b + \cos (a - b)) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} + \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b + \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b).
\end{align*}Finally,
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 - (\cos^2 a + \cos^2 b + \cos^2 (a - b) - 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)) \\
&= 1 - \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} - \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b - \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) \\
&= \boxed{1 - \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} - \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b - \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)}.
\end{align*} I hope it is correct.

The solution is correct! There's no error. 

The final solution is: 
  
  $\boxed{1 - \frac{\cos 3b}{2} \cos \frac{9a}{4} \cos \frac{3a}{4} - \frac{3}{2} \cos a \cos b - \frac{3}{4} \cos (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b)}$
ground_truth:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos (a - b) & \cos a \\ \cos(a - b) & 1 & \cos b \\ \cos a & \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} 1 & \cos b \\ \cos b & 1 \end{vmatrix} - \cos (a - b) \begin{vmatrix} \cos (a - b) & \cos b \\ \cos a  & 1 \end{vmatrix} + \cos a \begin{vmatrix} \cos (a - b) & 1 \\ \cos a  & \cos b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (1 - \cos^2 b) - \cos (a - b)(\cos (a - b) - \cos a \cos b) + \cos a (\cos (a - b) \cos b - \cos a) \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + \cos a \cos b \cos(a - b) + \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) - \cos^2 a \\
&= 1 - \cos^2 a - \cos^2 b - \cos^2 (a - b) + 2 \cos a \cos b \cos(a - b).
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
2 \cos a \cos b \cos (a - b) - \cos^2 (a - b) &= \cos (a - b) (2 \cos a \cos b - \cos (a - b)) \\
&= \cos (a - b) (\cos a \cos b - \sin a \sin b) \\
&= \cos (a - b) \cos (a + b) \\
&= \frac{1}{2} (\cos 2a + \cos 2b) \\
&= \cos^2 a - \frac{1}{2} + \cos^2 b - \frac{1}{2} \\
&= \cos^2 a + \cos^2 b - 1.
\end{align*}Therefore, the determinant is equal to $\boxed{0}.$
